page.title: 03THE VILLAGE OF WEST PENNARD
page.content: West Pennard is a T-shaped village with houses on either side of the main Glastonbury to Shepton Mallet road and a smaller road branching off to the south. The village is primarily a farming village. Once there were many small farms; now there are just a few large ones. Modern residential development has been limited to "in- filling" between older properties and many local stone cottages and farm houses still exist. There is one small development of a dozen council houses to the south of the village. Important buildings include the church, school and village hall. This was given to the village over 50 years ago and is now run by a committee and is self- financing. The post office is also the general store. On the main road there are garages and petrol stations and a public house with a skittle alley.
